intro: Cassipourea eickii, commonly known as the Eick's cassipourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
